pr_title: make build script portable on Mac OS

timeline.bodyText: I think build is easier to understand than bld
timeline.author: imay
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -295,7 +295,7 @@ build_gtest() {
     check_if_source_exist $GTEST_SOURCE
 
     cd $TP_SOURCE_DIR/$GTEST_SOURCE
-    mkdir build -p && cd build
+    mkdir -p bld && cd bld

replies.bodyText:
Projects that support build by bazel will contain a file named BUILD. Since the filesystem of Mac OS is not case sensitive, you cannot create a directory named build for those projects.
double-conversion-3.1.1/BUILD
re2-2017-05-01/BUILD
protobuf-3.5.1/BUILD
gflags-2.2.0/BUILD
incubator-brpc-0.9.5/BUILD
brotli-1.0.7/BUILD
flatbuffers-1.10.0/BUILD
mysql-server-mysql-5.7.18/BUILD
cctz-2.3/BUILD
glog-0.4.0/BUILD
replies.author: sduzh

replies.bodyText:
Thanks，I see.
Better to add comments about this reason. And is doris_build better?
replies.author: imay

timeline.message:
make build script portable on Mac OS

1. options of command `mkdir` and `cp` must be put before arguments on Mac OS.
2. directory name `build` is conflict with file `BUILD` on Mac OS.

make build script portable on Mac OS

1. options of command `mkdir` and `cp` must be put before arguments on Mac OS.
2. directory name `build` is conflict with file `BUILD` on Mac OS.
